comments:
I work on a large project that includes all kinds of files, including Java 
source files, .cpp and .cxx C++ files, Perl scripts, and even VMS files that 
have only "." as their file extension. The "." extension, especially, causes 
exceptions.

Using RC3, I tried to create a new Java project. I specified the Project 
Contents directory to be directory that holds several Java source trees as well 
as other trees holding various file types. Eclipse began to scan the project 
but soon gave an exception (text below) and quit.

Eclipse V2.0.2 handled the same project with no problems.

======================================================================

Moving to JDT/UI which seems performing the offending operation.
Martin, can you please comment on this. Do we treat every file as a CU ?

There is a bug in the test for the file extension. If the existing project
contains a file called 'java' (without extension) then the detector thinks that
this is a .java file and tries to create a CU.

What is bad that the exception is not handled locally but prevents the wizard
from correctly initializing to the default.

OK, since this only happens for files having the name 'java' (it doesn't 
happen for files lile JavaXXX). Although such a file exists in the scenario 
reporter bug the bug owner I think having files named 'java' isn't a common 
case. Given this, the fact that it doesn't cause harm to the workspace, and 
the fact that we only fix a handfull "critical" bugs for RC4, I opt to not fix 
for 2.1.

Should be doced in the readme.

I disagree with the assessment that the bug "doesn't cause harm to the 
workspace"... it prevents creation of the project, making eclipse unusable if 
the project should contain such files.

Would it be easy to ignore the files, display a message to that effect, and 
continue to create the project?

I know that this behaviour is annying for you. But given the fact that we only 
fix a handfull problems for RC4 this one got dropped due to the reason 
explained above. ("Cause harm" should read: no data loss and no currputed 
files).

But it will be fixed right after 2.1 and I guess it will go into 2.1.1.

Forgot to mention that 2.1 ships in the next days and that RC4 already got 
build. That's is the reason why we are currently so strickt in what we 
consider critical.

I understand, thanks. I found the files that were causing the problem (some 
files named "java" deep in the guts of the Tru64UNIX, HP-UX and VMS JRE's that 
we package with our product). I deleted them from my development machine, and 
was able to create the project with no other problems. Sorry to whine....

I consider eclipse to be a fine product, by the way, and I'm delighted that 
this tool is available free of charge. I work as a contractor at HP, and our 
entire team of 15 developers has switched to the eclipse IDE. Good job, you 
guys!

Merlin
*** Bug 36001 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

fixed in the 2.1.1 stream
reviewed by Dirk and Dani

ported the 3.0 stream

traces.message: Compilation unit name must end with .java.
Compilation unit name must end with .java.
